message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the cycle of seasons throughout the year. There are four seasons in a year, and each new season typically starts at the beginning of a new quarter. Option (A) is incorrect because seasons do not start every day. Option (C) is untrue because seasons are a natural occurrence. Option (D) is unrelated to the concept of seasons.

This question tests knowledge about the number of seasons in a year and how they transition. There are 4 seasons in a year (winter, spring, summer, autumn), and each new season typically starts every quarter of the year. Option (A) is incorrect because seasons do not start every day. Option (C) is false because seasons are a natural occurrence and not fake. Option (D) is unrelated to the question and does not provide accurate information about the start of a new season.

This question tests knowledge about the duration and pattern of seasons in a year. Option (A) is incorrect because a new season does not start every day, but rather every few months. Option (C) is incorrect because seasons are a natural phenomenon. Option (D) is incorrect because there are only four seasons, not seven. Option (B) is the correct answer because a new season starts every quarter, or every three months.

Option (C) is incorrect because seasons are a natural occurrence and not fake. Option (D) is incorrect because there are only 4 seasons, not seven.
